conversation.content: So, um, I've been thinking about, you know, taking a sabbatical next year, honestly.
A sabbatical? Right now? We're literally drowning in deadlines and you're thinking about taking time off? The quarterly review is in three weeks!
I know the timing seems [bitter] bad, but I've been here eight years without a real break.
Oh god, okay, but can we at least wait until after the merger? Everything's hanging by a thread and I can't handle this alone!
When would be a good time then?
There's never a [stern] perfect time, but literally any time except now when we're restructuring the entire department and I'm already working weekends!
It would only be three months.
Three months feels like three years when you're the only senior person left and everyone else is either new or completely checked out already!
Wait, who else is [relieved] leaving? I hadn't heard about anyone else.
Sarah's going on maternity leave, er, next month, and basically, Marcus just put in his two weeks, I mean, yesterday afternoon actually!
Marcus quit? But he, well, just got promoted and, like, seemed really happy about the new role, you know?
He got headhunted by, um, [very sincerely] that startup, and honestly, I can't even blame him because, well, they're offering twice what we pay.
This changes things. Maybe I should postpone.
Look, I'm [apologetic] sorry for freaking out, it's just that, uhh, everything's falling apart and, actually, I haven't slept properly in weeks.
You really think the department won't survive without me?
Survive? We'll barely function! You're the only one who knows the legacy systems and half our clients specifically request you for projects!
What if I helped train someone before I left?
Training someone properly takes months, not weeks, and honestly we don't even have anyone qualified enough to absorb what you do here!
Sounds like they should have hired backup years ago.
Absolutely! But here we are with zero redundancy, mounting pressure, and now you want to disappear when everything's already on fire!
